body:
Here's my reasoning, and excuse me if I'm way off here (I blame the lack of sleep on my cats):
`.Interface().(*X) == x`,  is there a specific reason `.MethodByName("Y").Interface().(func()) != x.Y`?

I realize you can't check for equality on functions, but what I mean is it returns a completely different function (I'm guessing it wraps the `Value` somehow) and that's why it's slow.

Keep in mind I'm not trying to call `Value.Call()`.

http://play.golang.org/p/hSEB6LlaOq
